page.title: 17Haughton Village.
page.content: Haughton was called Haulghton which meansÂ£a village in the meadows'. It has a population of about 1100 people in 340 homes.The homes are varied including flats and bungalows.About half the houses are modern,having been built in the last 15 years.The Church of St.Giles is about 700 years old.It has a stained glass window in memory of the son of a previous rector whose plane was shot down in the war.It is a very moving window.Haughton Hall is a black and white Elizabethan house It it is about 400 years old.Moathouse Farm is probably the oldest building in the village.There was a cruck cottage,which has now been rebuilt in the same style.The old Victorian school is now a house.The modern school is about 15 years old.There is a row of shops and a garage in the centre of the village.
